results.title: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit glass slides (Birds)
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are six parts to the bird slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.

results.title: Faster pussycat kill, kill. Mondo topless
results.creator_credit: Russ Meyer, Eve Meyer and Eve Productions
results.brief_description: Russ Meyer made famous this b-grade exploitation style of popular culture and in his films explored the people living on the edge or outside of the mainstream culture of the day. “Faster Pussycat Kill! Kill!” a cult classic centres around three women who are on a wild rampage of violence and revenge, a new breed of violence where sex is it’s favourite mantle and terrorizing people the order of the day. These “homicidal go-go’s” start their journey with a drag race across the desert followed by a violent showdown with local ranchers. The film is filled with hard-line one-liners, for example in answering the question “What’s the point?” the ringleader vixen Varla (Tura Satana) replies “The point is of no return, and you’ve just crossed it”. The second film “Mondo Topless” equally a cult classic is a montage of topless go-go dancers accompanied with voice overs from the dancers talking about their trade, motivations and views of their sexuality.

results.title: Alice Elliott
results.brief_description: The Promo Indians are among the world’s finest basket-makers. Alice Elliott is one of a few Promo continuing this centuries-old tradition.

results.title: Appeal
results.brief_description:
Edith lives alone with her cat, unhappy with her looks and her life, when media influence and an accident involving a peeler set her on a path to transform her body image. Initial improvement to Edith’s wellbeing is tragically compromised by obsession.

Film explores issues surrounding self image and eating disorders.

This work was created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT.
